data.title: Two Sum
data.statement:
Given an array of integers and an integer [[x]], return <<indices>> (plural of index) of two numbers in the array such that they <<add up to>> [[x]].

You may assume that each input would have <<exactly one solution>>, and <<you may not use the same element twice.>>

Return the answer with <<the lower number first.>>

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Given an array of integers and an integer x, return indices (plural of index) of two numbers in the array such that they add up to x.

You may assume that each input would have exactly one solution, and you may not use the same element twice.

Return the answer with the lower number first.
Input
Line 1: An integer x for the target value.
Line 2: An integer n for array length.
Line 3: n space-separated integers that could add up to x.
Output
Two space-separated indices of numbers that add up to x.
Constraints
Only one valid answer exists.
0≤ x≤ 82
4≤n≤ 22
Example
Input
5
4
0 1 3 5
Output
0 3
